property.name: class_name
property.help: The name of the base class.

property.name: title
property.help: The text to display on the frame's title bar.

option.name: wxFRAME_EX_CONTEXTHELP
option.help: Under Windows, puts a query button on the caption. When pressed, Windows will go into a context-sensitive help mode and wxWidgets will send a wxEVT_HELP event if the user clicked on an application window. You cannot use this style together with wxMAXIMIZE_BOX or wxMINIMIZE_BOX.

option.name: wxFRAME_EX_METAL
option.help: On Mac OS X, frames with this style will be shown with a metallic look.

property.name: center
property.help: Centers the window on the desktop in the chosen direction.

property.name: icon
property.help: Specifies the image to display in the title bar of the frame.

property.name: cpp_conditional
property.help: In C++ code, any value in this property will be used to place a conditional (#if/#endif) block around the Frame's generated code.

property.name: class_name
property.help: The name of the base class.

property.name: border
property.help: Specifies the type of border to use for the window.

option.name: wxPU_CONTAINS_CONTROLS
option.help: By default in wxMSW, a popup window will not take focus from its parent window. However many standard controls, including common ones such as wxTextCtrl, need focus to function correctly and will not work when placed on a default popup. This flag can be used to make the popup take focus and let all controls work but at the price of not allowing the parent window to keep focus while the popup is shown, which can also be sometimes desirable. This style is currently only implemented in MSW and simply does nothing under the other platforms. Requires wxWidgets 3.1.3

property.name: font
property.help: Sets the font for this window. This should not be used for a parent window if you don't want its font to be inherited by its children

property.name: foreground_colour
property.help: Sets the foreground colour of the window.

property.name: background_colour
property.help: Sets the background colour of the window.

property.name: cpp_conditional
property.help: In C++ code, any value in this property will be used to place a conditional (#if/#endif) block around the Window's generated code.

event.name: wxEVT_CONTEXT_MENU
event.help: Either provide your own handler function, or add a wxContextMenuEvent to create a popup menu.

event.name: wxEVT_DESTROY
event.help: Sent from the class destructor just before the window is destroyed.

property.name: class_name
property.help: The name of the base class.

property.name: theme
property.help: Select the RibbonBar theme.

property.name: cpp_conditional
property.help: In C++ code, any value in this property will be used to place a conditional (#if/#endif) block around the RibbonBar's generated code.

event.name: wxEVT_RIBBONBAR_PAGE_CHANGED
event.help: Triggered after the transition from one page being active to a different page being active.

event.name: wxEVT_RIBBONBAR_PAGE_CHANGING
event.help: Triggered prior to the transition from one page being active to a different page being active, and can veto the change.

event.name: wxEVT_RIBBONBAR_TAB_MIDDLE_DOWN
event.help: Triggered when the middle mouse button is pressed on a tab.

event.name: wxEVT_RIBBONBAR_TAB_MIDDLE_UP
event.help: Triggered when the middle mouse button is released on a tab.

event.name: wxEVT_RIBBONBAR_TAB_RIGHT_DOWN
event.help: Triggered when the right mouse button is pressed on a tab.

event.name: wxEVT_RIBBONBAR_TAB_RIGHT_UP
event.help: Triggered when the right mouse button is released on a tab.

event.name: wxEVT_RIBBONBAR_TAB_LEFT_DCLICK
event.help: Triggered when the left mouse button is double clicked on a tab.

event.name: wxEVT_RIBBONBAR_TOGGLED
event.help: Triggered when the button triggering the ribbon bar is clicked.

event.name: wxEVT_RIBBONBAR_HELP_CLICKED
event.help: Triggered when the help button is clicked.

property.name: class_name
property.help: The name of the base class.

property.name: title
property.help: The text to display on the dialog's title bar.

option.name: wxDIALOG_EX_CONTEXTHELP
option.help: Under Windows, puts a query button on the caption. When pressed, Windows will go into a context-sensitive help mode and wxWidgets will send a wxEVT_HELP event if the user clicked on an application window. Note: The Project's "help_provider" property must be set for context-sensitive help to work.

option.name: wxDIALOG_EX_METAL
option.help: On Mac OS X, frames with this style will be shown with a metallic look.

option.name: wxWS_EX_BLOCK_EVENTS
option.help: wxCommandEvents are propagated upward to the parent window, it's parent window, etc. Setting this flag blocks this propagation at this window, preventing events from being propagated further upwards.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_IDLE
option.help: The dialog should always process idle events, even if the mode set by wxIdleEvent::SetMode is wxIDLE_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_UI_UPDATES
option.help: The dialog should always process UI update events, even if the mode set by wxUpdateUIEvent::SetMode is wxUPDATE_UI_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

option.name: wxWS_EX_VALIDATE_RECURSIVELY
option.help: By default, Validate/TransferDataTo/FromWindow() only work on direct children of the window (compatible behaviour). Set this flag to make them recursively descend into all subwindows.

property.name: center
property.help: Centers the dialog box on the display in the chosen direction.

property.name: icon
property.help: Specifies the image to display in the title bar of the dialog.

property.name: cpp_conditional
property.help: In C++ code, any value in this property will be used to place a conditional (#if/#endif) block around the Dialog's generated code.

event.name: wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG
event.help: Generated when the dialog is being initialized.

property.name: class_name
property.help: The name of the base class.

property.name: mockup_size
property.help: This is the minimum size to display the panel in the Mockup Panel. It does not affect the actual size of the panel in your compiled code. Note that for a wxRibbonBar this needs to be as wide as the widest ribbon panel or you will see a question mark for the wxRibbonPage.

property.name: cpp_conditional
property.help: In C++ code, any value in this property will be used to place a conditional (#if/#endif) block around the Panel's generated code.

property.name: id
property.help: The identifier for the panel.

property.name: pos
property.help: Window position. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates that wxWidgets should generate a default position for the window.

property.name: size
property.help: Sets the panel size. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates that wxWidgets should generate a default size for the panel, large enough to display all visible elements.

property.name: minimum_size
property.help: Sets the minimum size of the panel. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates wxWidgets should calculate a minimum size large enough to display all visible elements.

property.name: maximum_size
property.help: Sets the maximum size of the panel.

option.name: wxWS_EX_VALIDATE_RECURSIVELY
option.help: By default, Validate/TransferDataTo/FromWindow() only work on direct children of the window (compatible behaviour). Set this flag to make them recursively descend into all subwindows.

option.name: wxWS_EX_BLOCK_EVENTS
option.help: wxCommandEvents are propagated upward to the parent window, it's parent window, etc. Setting this flag blocks this propagation at this window, preventing events from being propagated further upwards.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_IDLE
option.help: This window should always process idle events, even if the mode set by wxIdleEvent::SetMode is wxIDLE_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_UI_UPDATES
option.help: This window should always process UI update events, even if the mode set by wxUpdateUIEvent::SetMode is wxUPDATE_UI_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

property.name: disabled
property.help: Disable the window for user input. Note that when a parent window is disabled, all of its children are disabled as well and they are reenabled again when the parent is.

property.name: hidden
property.help: Shows or hides the window.

property.name: background_colour
property.help: Sets the background colour of the window. Use "Window" to let wxWidgets choose the color, otherwise specify one of the system colors in the list.

property.name: font
property.help: Sets the font for the panel. This should not be used if you don't want the font to be inherited by its children.

property.name: derived_class
property.help: If you have derived a class from wxPanel and you want to use your derived class, then specify that class name here. You will need to add the header file for your class to the base_hdr_includes property.

event.name: wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG
event.help: Generated when the panel is being initialized.

event.name: wxEVT_IDLE
event.help: Generated when the system becomes idle.

event.name: wxEVT_SHOW
event.help: Sent when the panel is shown or hidden.

property.name: class_name
property.help: The name of the base class.

property.name: title
property.help: The text to display on the PropertySheet's title bar.

property.name: prop_book_type
property.help: The type of book to use.

property.name: prop_shrink_to_fit
property.help: Shrinks the dialog window to fit the currently selected page (common behaviour for property sheets on macOS).

property.name: prop_buttons
property.help: Specifies the standard buttons to create.

property.name: prop_outer_border
property.help: Sets the border around the book control only. Size is in dialog units -- igorned if set to -1 (default).

property.name: prop_inner_border
property.help: Sets the border around the whole dialog. Size is in dialog units -- igorned if set to -1 (default).

option.name: wxDIALOG_EX_CONTEXTHELP
option.help: Under Windows, puts a query button on the caption. When pressed, Windows will go into a context-sensitive help mode and wxWidgets will send a wxEVT_HELP event if the user clicked on an application window. Note: The Project's "help_provider" property must be set for context-sensitive help to work.

option.name: wxDIALOG_EX_METAL
option.help: On Mac OS X, frames with this style will be shown with a metallic look.

option.name: wxWS_EX_BLOCK_EVENTS
option.help: wxCommandEvents are propagated upward to the parent window, it's parent window, etc. Setting this flag blocks this propagation at this window, preventing events from being propagated further upwards.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_IDLE
option.help: The dialog should always process idle events, even if the mode set by wxIdleEvent::SetMode is wxIDLE_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_UI_UPDATES
option.help: The dialog should always process UI update events, even if the mode set by wxUpdateUIEvent::SetMode is wxUPDATE_UI_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

option.name: wxWS_EX_VALIDATE_RECURSIVELY
option.help: By default, Validate/TransferDataTo/FromWindow() only work on direct children of the window (compatible behaviour). Set this flag to make them recursively descend into all subwindows.

property.name: prop_center
property.help: Centers the dialog box on the display in the chosen direction.

property.name: prop_icon
property.help: Specifies the image to display in the title bar of the dialog.

property.name: prop_cpp_conditional
property.help: In C++ code, any value in this property will be used to place a conditional (#if/#endif) block around the Dialog's generated code.

event.name: wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG
event.help: Generated when the dialog is being initialized.

event.name: OKButtonClicked
event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the OK button is clicked

event.name: YesButtonClicked
event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the Yes button is clicked

event.name: ApplyButtonClicked
event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the Apply the button is clicked

event.name: NoButtonClicked
event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the No button is clicked

event.name: CancelButtonClicked
event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the Cancel button is clicked

event.name: CloseButtonClicked
event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the Close button is clicked

event.name: HelpButtonClicked
event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the Help button is clicked

property.name: class_name
property.help: The name of the base class.

property.name: title
property.help: The text to display on the Wizard's title bar.

option.name: wxWIZARD_EX_HELPBUTTON
option.help: Shows a Help button using wxID_HELP.

property.name: border
property.help: Sets the width of the border around the page area.

property.name: center
property.help: Centers the dialog box on the display in the chosen direction.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: Bitmap to display on the left side of the wizard (default: none).

option.name: wxWIZARD_VALIGN_TOP
option.help: The bitmap is vertically aligned at the top.

option.name: wxWIZARD_VALIGN_CENTRE
option.help: The bitmap is centered vertically.

option.name: wxWIZARD_VALIGN_BOTTOM
option.help: The bitmap is vertically aligned at the bottom.

option.name: wxWIZARD_HALIGN_LEFT
option.help: The bitmap is horizontally aligned to the left.

option.name: wxWIZARD_HALIGN_CENTRE
option.help: The bitmap is horizontally aligned in the center.

option.name: wxWIZARD_HALIGN_RIGHT
option.help: The bitmap is horizontally aligned to the right.

option.name: wxWIZARD_TILE
option.help: The bitmap is tiled.

property.name: bmp_min_width
property.help: Sets the minimum width for the bitmap that will be constructed to contain the actual wizard or page bitmap if a non-zero bitmap placement flag has been set. If this is not set when using bitmap placement, the initial layout may be incorrect.

property.name: bmp_background_colour
property.help: Sets the colour that should be used to fill the area not taken up by the wizard or page bitmap, if a non-zero bitmap placement flag has been set.

event.name: wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG
event.help: Generated when the Wizard is being initialized.

event.name: wxEVT_WIZARD_PAGE_CHANGED
event.help: This event cannot be vetoed.

event.name: wxEVT_WIZARD_PAGE_CHANGING
event.help: This event can be vetoed.

event.name: wxEVT_WIZARD_BEFORE_PAGE_CHANGED
event.help: Generated after Next is clicked but before GetNext is called. Unlike wxEVT_WIZARD_PAGE_CHANGING, the handler for this function can change state that might affect the return value of GetNext. This event can be vetoed.

event.name: wxEVT_WIZARD_PAGE_SHOWN
event.help: The page was shown and laid out (this event cannot be vetoed).

event.name: wxEVT_WIZARD_CANCEL
event.help: The user attempted to cancel the wizard (this event may be vetoed).

event.name: wxEVT_WIZARD_HELP
event.help: Generated when the help button is pressed.

event.name: wxEVT_WIZARD_FINISHED
event.help: Generated when the finish button is pressed.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: Page-specific bitmap (default: none).
